com.espian.showcaseview

Class ShowcaseView

  • java.lang.Object
    • android.view.View
      • android.view.ViewGroup
        • android.widget.RelativeLayout
          • com.espian.showcaseview.ShowcaseView
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    android.graphics.drawable.Drawable.Callback, android.view.accessibility.AccessibilityEventSource, android.view.KeyEvent.Callback, android.view.View.OnClickListener, android.view.View.OnTouchListener, android.view.ViewManager, android.view.ViewParent

    public class ShowcaseView
extends android.widget.RelativeLayout
implements android.view.View.OnClickListener, android.view.View.OnTouchListener
    A view which allows you to showcase areas of your app with an explanation.

      • animateGesture

        public void animateGesture(float offsetStartX,
                           float offsetStartY,
                           float offsetEndX,
                           float offsetEndY)
        Adds an animated hand performing a gesture. All parameters passed to this method are relative to the center of the showcased view.
        Parameters:
        offsetStartX - x-offset of the start position
        offsetStartY - y-offset of the start position
        offsetEndX - x-offset of the end position
        offsetEndY - y-offset of the end position
        See Also:
        animateGesture(float, float, float, float, boolean)

      • animateGesture

        public void animateGesture(float startX,
                           float startY,
                           float endX,
                           float endY,
                           boolean absoluteCoordinates)
        Adds an animated hand performing a gesture.
        Parameters:
        startX - x-coordinate or x-offset of the start position
        startY - y-coordinate or x-offset of the start position
        endX - x-coordinate or x-offset of the end position
        endY - y-coordinate or x-offset of the end position
        absoluteCoordinates - If true, this will use absolute coordinates instead of coordinates relative to the center of the showcased view

      • insertShowcaseViewWithType

        @Deprecated
public static ShowcaseView insertShowcaseViewWithType(int type,
                                                                  int itemId,
                                                                  android.app.Activity activity,
                                                                  java.lang.String title,
                                                                  java.lang.String detailText,
                                                                  ShowcaseView.ConfigOptions options)
        Deprecated. use insertShowcaseView with Target
        Quickly insert a ShowcaseView into an Activity, highlighting an item.
        Parameters:
        type - the type of item to showcase (can be ITEM_ACTION_HOME, ITEM_TITLE_OR_SPINNER, ITEM_ACTION_ITEM or ITEM_ACTION_OVERFLOW)
        itemId - the ID of an Action item to showcase (only required for ITEM_ACTION_ITEM
        activity - Activity to insert the ShowcaseView into
        title - Text to show as a title. Can be null.
        detailText - More detailed text. Can be null.
        options - A set of options to customise the ShowcaseView
        Returns:
        the created ShowcaseView instance
